explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as "flammable" by ICSC (2004).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 375degC (ICSC, 2004)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available - melting point: 70degC (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 140degC

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 1,210mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 1,475mg/kg (SIDS (2003)), 1,876mg/kg (SIDS (2003)), 1,210mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the testing data of rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 1,438mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 98-1 (1999)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LC50 (4-hour inhalation) of 8.16mg/L (SIDS (2003)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 98-1 (1999)): the substance is considered to cause "mild irritation," although 4-hour application tests are not available.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 98-1 (1999)): the substance is considered to cause "moderate irritation."

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the results of two guinea pigs skin sensitization tests - "not sensitizing" (SIDS (2003)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on germ cell multi-generation mutagenicity tests in vivo and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests, micronucleus tests), described in IARC 71 (1999), SIDS (2003) DFGOT vol. 4 (1992) and NTP DB (Access on September 2005).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A5 by ACGIH (2003) and Group 4 by IARC (1999).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the description in SIDS (2003), ACGIH (7th, 2001) and IARC 71 (1999): Only nonspecific secondary effects, toxicologically insignificant effects or minimal effects are observed at dosing levels associated with general toxicity.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (nervous system, circulatory system), Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (nervous system, circulatory system) May cause drowsiness or dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects) May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "oversensitiveness, somnolency, nasal hemorrhage, catarrh of the upper respiratory tract, dry nose and lips with cracks" (CERI Hazard Data 98-1 (1999), "disorder of the nervous and circulatory systems" (CERI Hazard Data 98-1 (1999)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "an increase in bronchial response following nasal and upper respiratory irritation, respiratory disorder including impaired pulmonary function" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)), and the evidence from animal studies including "labored respiration, nasal mucus, moist rale, moderate nasal turbinate respiratory mucosa hypertrophy and hyperplasia of the goblet cells in the nasal respiratory mucosa, deposition of eosinophilic substances in olfactory epithelial cells" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 96 hours LC50>100mg/L of the fish (Oryzias Latipest) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals (2001) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =7.72*105mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.
